Class BuildSceneController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.cg04.client.view.gui.controllers.ViewController
it.polimi.ingsw.cg04.client.view.gui.controllers.BuildSceneController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class BuildSceneController extends ViewController

  • Constructor Details

    • BuildSceneController

      public BuildSceneController()

  • Method Details

    • setGUI

      public void setGUI(GUIRoot gui)
      Sets the GUI root reference for this build scene controller. This method establishes the connection between the controller and the main GUI class, enabling communication with the game client and other GUI components.
      Overrides:
      setGUI in class ViewController
      Parameters:
      gui - the GUIRoot instance that manages the overall GUI state and client communication

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the build scene controller and sets up all UI components and event handlers. JavaFX automatically calls this method after loading the FXML file and configures: - Responsive UI scaling based on window size changes - Drag and drop functionality for tiles and crew members - Event handlers for tile rotation and selection - Initial state of UI components
      Parameters:
      url - the location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if unknown
      resourceBundle - the resources used to localize the root object, or null if not localized

    • scaleUI

      private void scaleUI()
      Scales and centers the UI components to maintain aspect ratio when the window is resized. Calculates the appropriate scale factor based on the current window dimensions compared to the base dimensions, then applies uniform scaling and centering to the scalable group. This ensures the game interface remains properly proportioned and centered regardless of window size.

    • initDragAndDrop

      private void initDragAndDrop()
      Initializes drag and drop functionality for the held tile component. Sets up the drag detection event handler that creates a visual representation of the tile being dragged, including proper scaling and rotation to match the current tile state. The drag image is created with transparent background and centered cursor positioning for better user experience.

    • setDragAndDrop

      public void setDragAndDrop(javafx.scene.image.ImageView alien, CrewType crewType)
      Sets up drag and drop functionality for crew alien ImageViews. Configures the specified alien ImageView to be draggable, creating a visual drag representation with fixed dimensions and including the crew type information in the drag data for proper drop validation.
      Parameters:
      alien - the ImageView representing the crew alien to make draggable
      crewType - the type of crew member (PINK_ALIEN or BROWN_ALIEN) for identification during drop operations

    • clearAllDragAndDropEvents

      private void clearAllDragAndDropEvents()
      Clears all drag and drop event handlers from ship grid and buffer grid components. This method removes existing drag event listeners to prevent interference when switching between different game states or UI modes.

    • handleDraw

      private void handleDraw()
      Handles the draw button click event by requesting a face-down tile from the server. Sends a draw request to the GUI controller to obtain a new tile from the deck.

    • handleShowFaceUp

      private void handleShowFaceUp()
      Handles the show face-up tiles button click event. Requests the GUI to display the currently available face-up tiles.

    • viewOther

      private void viewOther()
      Handles the view other ships button click event. Requests the GUI to display other players' ships for inspection.

    • handleEndButtonClick

      private void handleEndButtonClick()
      Handles the end building button click event. Transitions the UI to show the end building scene where players can select their starting position on the flight board.

    • handleBackButtonClick

      private void handleBackButtonClick()
      Handles the back button click event. Returns the UI to the main build scene from other sub-scenes.

    • handleCheatsButtonClick

      public void handleCheatsButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the cheats button click event. Displays the cheats popup scene for testing or development purposes.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action event triggered by the button click

    • onShip1Click

      public void onShip1Click(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the ship 1 cheat button click. Places a test tile at coordinates (103, 103) for development/testing purposes.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action event triggered by the button click

    • onShip2Click

      public void onShip2Click(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the ship 2 cheat button click. Places a test tile at coordinates (104, 104) for development/testing purposes.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action event triggered by the button click

    • onShip3Click

      public void onShip3Click(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the ship 3 cheat button click. Places a test tile at coordinates (105, 105) for development/testing purposes.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action event triggered by the button click

    • handleFixButtonClick

      private void handleFixButtonClick()
      Handles the fix button click event during ship repair phase. Sends the list of selected tiles to break to the GUI controller and clears all highlighting and selection state.

    • showBuildScene

      public void showBuildScene()
      Shows the main build scene and hides other sub-scenes. Sets visibility and management properties for the primary building interface.

    • showEndBuildingScene

      public void showEndBuildingScene()
      Shows the end building scene and hides the main build scene. Displays the interface for selecting starting positions on the flight board.

    • showCheatsScene

      public void showCheatsScene()
      Shows the cheats popup scene for development/testing purposes. Displays additional controls for testing game functionality.

    • showFixButton

      public void showFixButton()
      Shows the fix button and hides all other action buttons. Used during the ship repair phase to provide the appropriate UI controls.

    • hideAllButtons

      public void hideAllButtons()
      Hides all action buttons in the interface. Sets visibility and management properties to false for all control buttons.

    • hideButton

      public void hideButton(javafx.scene.control.Button button)
      Hides the specified button by setting its visibility and management to false.
      Parameters:
      button - the button to hide

    • showButton

      public void showButton(javafx.scene.control.Button button)
      Shows the specified button by setting its visibility and management to true.
      Parameters:
      button - the button to show

    • hidePane

      public void hidePane(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane)
      Hides the specified pane by setting its visibility and management to false.
      Parameters:
      pane - the pane to hide

    • showPane

      public void showPane(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane)
      Shows the specified pane by setting its visibility and management to true.
      Parameters:
      pane - the pane to show

    • updateLoadCrewController

      public void updateLoadCrewController(Game game)
      Updates the controller for the crew loading phase. Configures the interface for placing crew members on the ship by setting up drag and drop functionality and hiding unnecessary UI elements.
      Overrides:
      updateLoadCrewController in class ViewController
      Parameters:
      game - the current game state containing player and ship information

    • updateBuildController

      public void updateBuildController(Game game)
      Updates the controller for the main building phase. Refreshes all UI components based on the current game state, including ship grid, held tile, face-up tiles, and level-specific elements.
      Overrides:
      updateBuildController in class ViewController
      Parameters:
      game - the current game state

    • update

      public void update(Game game)
      Updates the controller with the current game state and refreshes the scene accordingly. This method logs the client's nickname for debugging purposes, retrieves the current game level, composes the scene layout based on the level-specific requirements, and delegates state-specific updates to the game state controller. The method ensures the UI is properly synchronized with the current game state and level configuration.
      Overrides:
      update in class ViewController
      Parameters:
      game - the Game object containing the current state, level, and game state controller

    • composeSceneByLevel

      private void composeSceneByLevel(int level)
      Configures the scene appearance and functionality based on the game level. Loads appropriate background images, ship graphics, and flight board images, and sets up level-specific UI elements and button behaviors.
      Parameters:
      level - the current game level (1 or 2)

    • selectHeldTile

      private void selectHeldTile(boolean selected)
      Applies or removes visual selection effects on the held tile. When selected, adds a golden drop shadow effect and focuses the tile. When deselected, removes effects and returns focus to the root.
      Parameters:
      selected - true to select the tile, false to deselect

    • updateHeldTile

      public void updateHeldTile(Tile tile)
      Updates the held tile display based on the current tile state. Shows or hides the tile image, sets appropriate rotation, and configures the draw button behavior based on whether a tile is currently held.
      Parameters:
      tile - the tile currently held by the player, or null if no tile is held

    • updateShipForLoadCrew

      public void updateShipForLoadCrew(Player p)
      Updates the ship grid display for the crew loading phase. Configures drag and drop functionality for placing crew members on tiles that support them, and displays existing crew placements.
      Parameters:
      p - the player whose ship is being updated

    • updateShipGrid

      public void updateShipGrid(Player p)
      Updates the ship grid display for the main building phase. Shows current tiles, sets up drag and drop for tile placement, and handles special states like ship fixing mode.
      Parameters:
      p - the player whose ship is being updated

    • setFixEffects

      public void setFixEffects(javafx.scene.image.ImageView cell, int row, int col)
      Sets up click effects for tiles during the ship fixing phase. Allows players to select and deselect tiles for removal by clicking on them. Selected tiles are highlighted with a golden drop shadow effect.
      Parameters:
      cell - the ImageView representing the tile
      row - the row coordinate of the tile
      col - the column coordinate of the tile

    • updatePiles

      public void updatePiles(Player p)
      Updates the piles display based on current game state. Shows either the contents of a selected pile or the backs of available piles, and sets up appropriate click handlers for pile interaction.
      Parameters:
      p - the player whose pile state is being updated

    • updateFaceUpTiles

      public void updateFaceUpTiles(Game g)
      Updates the face-up tiles display. Shows the currently available face-up tiles that players can choose from, and sets up click handlers for tile selection with hover effects.
      Parameters:
      g - the current game state containing face-up tile information

    • updateTimer

      public void updateTimer(Game g)
      Updates the timer button based on the current timer state. Changes button text and functionality between "Timer" (to start) and "Stop" (to end) based on remaining timer flips in the game.
      Parameters:
      g - the current game state containing timer information

    • updateBuffer

      public void updateBuffer(Ship s)
      Updates the buffer tiles display for level 2 gameplay. Shows tiles in the buffer and sets up drag and drop functionality for empty buffer slots and click handlers for filled slots.
      Parameters:
      s - the ship containing the buffer to update

    • setupTrianglePositions

      private void setupTrianglePositions(int level)
      Sets up the triangle position mappings and event handlers for the flight board. Configures hover effects and click handlers for triangular position selectors based on the current game level, allowing players to choose their starting position.
      Parameters:
      level - the current game level (1 or 2) determining which triangle set to use

    • updateFreePositions

      private void updateFreePositions(Game g)
      Updates the visual state of triangular position selectors based on occupied positions. Colors triangles according to the player occupying each position and disables interaction for already taken positions.
      Parameters:
      g - the current game state containing flight board information

    • disableTriangle

      private void disableTriangle(javafx.scene.shape.Polygon triangle)
      Disables a triangle position selector and removes all interaction handlers. Used when a position has been selected or is no longer available.
      Parameters:
      triangle - the triangle polygon to disable

    • updateHousingTile

      public void updateHousingTile(Coordinates c, javafx.scene.layout.StackPane stackPane)
      Updates the visual representation of a tile that houses crew members. Adds crew alien images to the specified stack pane based on the crew type currently assigned to the given coordinates.
      Parameters:
      c - the coordinates of the tile housing the crew
      stackPane - the UI container where the crew image should be displayed

    • showLogs

      public void showLogs(List<String> logLines)
      Updates the logs display with the provided log lines. Concatenates all log entries and displays them in the logs text area using Platform.runLater to ensure UI thread safety.
      Overrides:
      showLogs in class ViewController
      Parameters:
      logLines - the list of log messages to display, or null if no logs available

    • goToBuildScene

      public void goToBuildScene(GUIRoot gui) throws IOException
      Navigates to the build scene (no-op implementation). This method is part of the ViewController interface but performs no action in this controller as the build scene is already the primary scene.
      Overrides:
      goToBuildScene in class ViewController
      Parameters:
      gui - the GUI root reference (unused in this implementation)
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs (not thrown in this implementation)
